title: dzypher
author: dzypher
content: Hello Bitcointalk community,It's been a long six years since I first created this account, going by the name 'dzypher' to keep a low profile. Back then, my only intention was to be a silent observer, to be a tiny part of the Bitcointalk history without actively participating in discussions. However, life has a way of surprising us, and today, I feel compelled to break my silence and share a personal triumph with all of you.Cancer, a word that changes everything, became an unexpected chapter in my life. But here I am, on the other side of it, not just surviving but thriving. The bills, reminders of the battle fought, are now being covered by the earnings from my ventures into ALTCOINS and MINING. It's amazing how the crypto world, which started as an exploration, has become a lifeline in overcoming life's challenges.During those tough days on the hospital bed, surrounded by the hum of machines and the sterile hospital environment, my mind was far from idle. Years of delving into the intricacies of crypto and blockchain fueled my imagination. It was during those moments of solitude that a vision emerged – a desire to tackle the complexities of cross-border fiat payments using blockchain technology. A goal to make these transactions more seamless, secure, and accessible.Beyond the digital space, I'm eager to connect with those who share a passion for crypto and blockchain. So, if anyone's up for it, I'd love to have a virtual coffee with you. An online gathering where we can share ideas, insights, and maybe form connections that go beyond the digital boundaries of this forum.Thank you for taking the time to read my story. I'm looking forward to engaging with this dynamic community and exploring the endless possibilities that the crypto world offers. Feel free to drop a comment if you'd like to join me for an online coffee or share your thoughts on my journey and aspirations. Cheers!

comments.body: Hi dzypher, welcome back to the Bitcointalk community and sorry about the hard times you went through. It's nice to know that you won the battle.I am just curious on what altcoins you did mine at that time and are you still mining them?

We all have those battles we fight every day, but some battles are tougher than others. It's nice to know that you won the battle.I am just curious on what altcoins you did mine at that time and are you still mining them?I put a few dollars into Ethereum and invested in mining rigs specifically for Ethereum until its eth2.0 upgrade. Later, I shifted my focus to mining low-market-cap altcoins, anticipating their future value appreciation.I've set up one validator node, running it on eth2.0 to generate passive income. Additionally, I invested in newly launched NFT projects like Axie Infinity (play-to-earn), Pegaxy (play-to-earn), Azuki (profile picture NFT), and Illuvium (play-to-earn, AAA).It's important to note that I'm not advocating for investment in the mentioned projects. I'm not a financial advisor; I encourage you to do your own research, mate.

Although it may not be so much of a deal to some of those who have in-depth knowledge on the mentioned projects since a lot of them have been performing poorly since their lunch and could be a big discouragement for others who may be in such situations and looking for an investment that can truly earn them profits, but since in the ops situation is about recovery from such deadly situation as this,  it has become important to look away from the performance of those coins to see how his recovering process have been motivated via his active participation in mining those coins and not really on the profits making of the investment at some point.

Life isn't fair to all, dealing us dirty when we least expect. OP, it's good to hear you made it through your issues of life. Welcome back.
